document_data.name: Sa'ar
document_data.mainbody:
Sheikh '''Sa'ar''' was the leader of the [[Bait Mahwa]] tribe of the [[Bedine]] people for a time during the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{Quote|Accept my apologies, all I have is a big buck that my arrow downed yesterday. My wives have spent the morning basting it with [[honey]] and [[spice]]s, but I am sure it cannot compare to [[camel]]'s blood.|Sa'ar, demonstrating his hospitality and sarcasm.}}
document_data.Description: He was a burly man with a hard face and eyes that hinted at his cunning and experience.
document_data.Personality: Among the members of numerous Bedine tribes, Sa'ar was known as a particularly intelligent leader.
document_data.Relationships: Sa'ar had a strong ally in Sheikh [[Utaiba]], leader of the [[Raz'hadi]] tribe. During the times Sa'ar grew contentious with others, it was Utaiba who could calm his friend and help him listen to reason.

History.Leader of the Bedine:
In the {{YearlinkName|1360}}, Sheikh Sa'ar was approached by [[Yhekal]], an agent of the [[Zhentarim]] that hoped to form an "alliance" between his tribe and the outlander merchant's group. The meeting was interrupted by the [[Qahtan]]i sorceress [[Ruha]] and the [[Harpers]] agent [[Lander]], who warned that the [[Zhentilar]] army slaughtered the [[Mtair Dhafir]] and Qahtan tribes. They traveled to the [[Well of the Chasm]] to regroup with tan allied tribe, routing the Zhent camp outside the oasis, and joining the [[Raz'hadi]] in another victory at the [[Battle of the Chasm]].

Following the battles, Sa'ar and Utaiba brought together fifteen other sheikhs of the Bedine tribes to the sacred [[Elah'zad]] oasis to confer on what was to be done with the Zhentarim threat. They ultimately decided to fight as one united people, gathering all the Bedine within over a [[tenday]]'s ride away from the oasis. Under the united leadership, the Bedine went on to claim victory against the asabis at the [[Battle of the Fissures]], and finally turn away the Zhentarim from [[the Sword]] during the siege of [[Orofin]].
